intro: Erigeron capillipes, commonly known as the slenderleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It has fine, hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in a soft, downy layer. Its small white to pale blue flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
